name: Port Street Light: Good Things Come in Pairs
description: This elegant-looking Liyue streetlamp utilizes strong and durable Cuihua Wood for its primary structure, with linked lanterns as the light source.\nRumor holds that some residents of Yilong Wharf believe that even numbers are auspicious, and therefore strongly advise against taking down just a single lantern at a time. In reality, artisans chose this design for more practical reasons â€” dual sources of illumination provide redundancy, preventing damage to a single lantern from rendering the light source ineffective, while also making it easier for the Millelith to use them as an emergency source for lanterns in certain extenuating circumstances. As for its meaning regarding good fortune, that can be regarded more as a happy coincidence...
